etymology.description: Hands 廾 braiding thread 糸; top resembles 生 without the diagonal stroke (cf. 責, 青).
etymology.interpretation: Depicts two hands working with threads, evoking the idea of woven or plain silk. Over time it extended from unadorned silk to senses like plain, simple style and vegetarian, and appears in compounds like 元素 for scientific ‘element’.

examples.chinese: 她喜欢素色的衣服(她喜歡素色的衣服)。
化学里(化學裡)，氢是最轻的元素(氫是最輕的元素)。
examples.pinyin: Huàxué lǐ, qīng shì zuì qīng de yuánsù.
examples.english: In chemistry, hydrogen is the lightest element.
